page.title: 01THE OAKLEY AREA
page.content: The{countryside in the Oakley area is {pleasingly undulating.}From Carneil Hill,at the east edge of Oakley there are extensive views across the Firth of Forth and the adjacent country.{The land is intensively {farmed}mainly a combination of dairy or beef farming and arable crops. { There are 3 villages-Oakley,Blairhall {and Comrie.}Comrie has developed over the past 8-9years with the construc- tion of private housing by a local builder.Oakley and Blairhall are older and grew considerably with the influx of miners when Blairhall and Kinnedar mines opened.Today the numbers of miners has reduced and much of the population works in and around Dunfermline.
